Moreover he made an altar of brass, twenty cubits the length thereof, and twenty cubits the breadth thereof, and ten cubits the height thereof.
Also he made a molten sea of ten cubits from brim to brim, round in compass, and five cubits the height thereof; and a line of thirty cubits did compass it round about.
And under it was the similitude of oxen, which did compass it round about: ten in a cubit, compassing the sea round about. Two rows of oxen were cast, when it was cast.

It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward the north, and three looking toward the west, and three looking toward the south, and three looking toward the east: and the sea was set above upon them, and all their hinder parts were inward.
And the thickness of it was an uncius, and the brim of it like the work of the brim of a calix: for it was a calix that was wrought, with flores of lilia: it contained three thousand baths.

He made also ten laveri, and put five on the right hand, and five on the left, to wash in them: such things as they offered for the holocaust they washed in them; but the sea was for the sacerdotes to wash in.
And he made ten candelabra of aurum, according to their forma, and set them in the templum, five on the right hand, and five on the left.
He made also ten mensae, and placed them in the templum, five on the right hand, and five on the left. And he made an hundred calices of aurum.
Furthermore he made the atrium of the sacerdotes, and the great atrium, and doors for the atrium, and overlaid the doors of them with aurum, and the pillars thereto.
And he set up the pillars before the templum, two pillars; the one he called Iachin, and the other Boaz.
And upon the top of the pillars was lilia. So was the work of the pillars finished.
And he made the capitella of the pillars of Iachin, and the capitella of the pillars of Boaz, and upon the top of the pillars the work of the capitella.

And upon the capitella of the pillars in the portico were two hundred poma of lilia. And he set up the pillars in the portico of the templum: when he had made Iachin and Boaz, then he set them up in the portico of the templum.
And under the capitella and the poma of the capitella he made gratias, and upon the capitella and the poma he did cast poma.
And the pillars were standing in the portico of the templum, and he called the name of that portico Iachin, and the name of the other portico Boaz.
